evade.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to avoid talking about something, especially because you are trying to hide something
evade.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I could tell that he was trying to evade the issue.
evade.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to not do or deal with something that you should do
evade.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
evade.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to avoid paying money that you ought to pay, for example tax
evade.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Employers will always try to find ways to evade tax.
evade.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to escape from someone who is trying to catch you
evade.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: She managed to evade the police.
So far he has evaded capture.
evade.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if something evades you, you cannot do it or understand it
evade.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The subtleties of his argument evaded me.
evade.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to not do something that you should do according to the law, for example not paying tax
evade.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He was charged with evading $12.6 million of taxes.
